strategy: Introduce deep neural networks with a feedforward architecture (e.g., 3-5 hidden layers with ReLU activations) to model complex, non-linear relationships in the data. Use a temporal embedding layer to encode categorical variables like 'neighborhood' and 'condition' as learned embeddings, capturing semantic similarities across categories. Apply batch normalization and dropout layers to improve generalization. Train using a combination of mean squared error and a custom loss function that penalizes high-priority outliers (e.g., top 1% of prices) based on median absolute deviation to mitigate skew. Use temporal splits with temporal validation to ensure no leakage.

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder, RobustScaler
from tensorflow.keras.models import Sequential
from tensorflow.keras.layers import Dense, Dropout, BatchNormalization, Embedding
from tensorflow.keras.optimizers import Adam
from tensorflow.keras.callbacks import EarlyStopping
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Prepare features and target
X = train_df.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y = train_df['SalePrice']

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Handle missing values
X[numerical_columns] = X[numerical_columns].fillna(X[numerical_columns].median())
X[categorical_columns] = X[categorical_columns].fillna(X[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])

# Prepare test data
test_X = test_df.drop(['Id'], axis=1)
test_X[numerical_columns] = test_X[numerical_columns].fillna(test_X[numerical_columns].median())
test_X[categorical_columns] = test_X[categorical_columns].fillna(test_X[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])

# One-hot encode categorical features
encoder = OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore', drop='first', sparse_output=False)
X_encoded = encoder.fit_transform(X[categorical_columns])
X_encoded_df = pd.DataFrame(X_encoded, columns=encoder.get_feature_names_out(categorical_columns))

test_X_encoded = encoder.transform(test_X[categorical_columns])
test_X_encoded_df = pd.DataFrame(test_X_encoded, columns=encoder.get_feature_names_out(categorical_columns))

# Combine with numerical features
X_final = pd.concat([X[numerical_columns], X_encoded_df], axis=1)
test_X_final = pd.concat([test_X[numerical_columns], test_X_encoded_df], axis=1)

# Normalize numerical features

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder, RobustScaler
from sklearn.ensemble import GradientBoostingRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Prepare features and target
X = train_df.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y = train_df['SalePrice']

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Handle missing values
X[numerical_columns] = X[numerical_columns].fillna(X[numerical_columns].median())
X[categorical_columns] = X[categorical_columns].fillna(X[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])

# Prepare test data
test_X = test_df.drop(['Id'], axis=1)
test_X[numerical_columns] = test_X[numerical_columns].fillna(test_X[numerical_columns].median())
test_X[categorical_columns] = test_X[categorical_columns].fillna(test_X[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0])

# One-hot encode categorical features
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
encoder = OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore', drop='first', sparse_output=False)
X_encoded = encoder.fit_transform(X[categorical_columns])
X_encoded_df = pd.DataFrame(X_encoded, columns=encoder.get_feature_names_out(categorical_columns))

test_X_encoded = encoder.transform(test_X[categorical_columns])
test_X_encoded_df = pd.DataFrame(test_X_encoded, columns=encoder.get_feature_names_out(categorical_columns))

# Combine with numerical features
X_final = pd.concat([X[numerical_columns], X_encoded_df], axis=1)
test_X_final = pd.concat([test_X[numerical_columns], test_X_encoded_df], axis=1)

# Normalize numerical features
scaler = RobustScaler()
X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_final)
test_X_scaled = scaler.
